snippet: While Tibetan rights advocates have long been inured to impassive officials, they are troubled by the lack of reaction from Chinese intellectuals and the liberal online commentariat.
abstract: Tibetan rights advocates are increasingly troubled by deafening silence among Chinese intellectuals amid wave of Tibetan self-immolations and protests.

byline.contributor: Shi Da, Amy Qin and Chang Lu contributed research.

lead_paragraph: While Tibetan rights advocates have long been inured to impassive officials, they are troubled by the lack of reaction from Chinese intellectuals and the liberal online commentariat.

headline.seo: Educated Chinese Are Silent Amid Tibetan Self-Immolations
headline.main: Many Chinese Intellectuals Are Silent Amid a Wave of Tibetan Self-Immolations
headline.print_headline: Many Chinese Intellectuals Are Silent Amid a Wave of Tibetan Self-Immolations
